page.title: 14DEIGHTON HUDDERSFIELD
page.content: At the top of Ochrewell Avenue there is a Police Box. I once had my bike stamped there. There are police cars and vans going in and out all day. Outside this there is a bus-stop. Further down at the side of it there is a Post Office and at the side of that there is an Off-Licence. At the top of that road, there is a Chinese take-away and a Newspaper shop. There is also a phone-box. Most of my area is covered in housing but there are some fields at the back of the bungalows which run along the bottom road. We have a graveyard but men are removing the remains to move elsewhere so that they can build something else on the site. We have a dentist, a video shop and a supermarket.
